intro: Iberis amara subsp. peyerimhoffii, commonly known as the Peyer’s bittercress, is a flowering plant native to parts of southern Europe and western Asia. It is a low-growing perennial that produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant has hairy, lobed leaves that are often covered in a fine pubescence. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats. The species is characterized by its distinctive, bitter-tasting leaves and its ability to tolerate harsh environmental conditions.
